tags: Custom Speech datasets for model adaptation:
post.summary: Uploads data and creates a new dataset.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of this dataset (always add this string for any dataset).

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Optional description of this dataset.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The locale of this dataset (always add this string for any dataset).

parameters.name: dataImportKind
parameters.description: The kind of the dataset (always add this string for any dataset). Possible values are "Language", "Acoustic", "Pronunciation".

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Optional properties of this dataset (json serialized object with key/values, where all values must be strings)

parameters.name: audiodata
parameters.description: A zip file containing the audio data (this and the audio archive file for acoustic datasets).

parameters.name: transcriptions
parameters.description: A text file containing the transcriptions for the audio data (this and the transcriptions file for acoustic datasets).

parameters.name: languagedata
parameters.description: A text file containing the language or pronunciation data (only this file for language datasets).

properties.description:
The custom properties of this entity. The maximum allowed key length is 64 characters, the maximum
allowed value length is 256 characters and the count of allowed entries is 10.

locale.description: The locale of the contained data.

lastActionDateTime.description:
The time-stamp when the current status was entered.
The time stamp is encoded as ISO 8601 date and time format
("YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations).

createdDateTime.description:
The time-stamp when the object was created.
The time stamp is encoded as ISO 8601 date and time format
("YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations).

Error.title: Error
Error.description: The interface represents the content of an error response defined in the OneAPI v2.1 documentation.

details.description: An array of details representing distinct related errors that occurred during the request.

code.description:
A service-defined error code that should be human-readable.
This code serves as a more specific indicator of the error than
the HTTP error code specified in the response.

message.description:
A human-readable representation of the error. It is intended as
an aid to developers and is not suitable for exposure to end users.

target.description: The target of the particular error (e.g., the name of the property in error).

ErrorDetail.title: ErrorDetail
ErrorDetail.description: An array of implementations of this interface can be used as details for an error.

code.description:
A service-defined error code that should be human-readable.
This code serves as a more specific indicator of the error than
the HTTP error code specified in the response.

message.description:
A human-readable representation of the error. It is intended as
an aid to developers and is not suitable for exposure to end users.

target.description: The target of the particular error (e.g., the name of the property in error).

InnerErrorV2.title: InnerErrorV2
InnerErrorV2.description:
An implementation of this interface represents a stage in a stack trace.
If the error level is the root, the Microsoft.SpeechServices.Http.Dto.IInnerError.Code and the Microsoft.SpeechServices.Http.Dto.IInnerError.InnerError
property may be omitted.

code.description:

This code serves as a more specific indicator of the error than
the HTTP error code specified in the response.

Status.title: Status
Status.description: Describe the current state of the API

values.description: The long running operation has not yet started.
The long running operation is currently processing.
The long running operation has successfully completed.
The long running operation has failed.

resultsUrl.description:
The URL that can be used to download the test results.
Each line in the file represents a tab separated list of filename, reference transcription and decoder output.
            
The URL will only be valid, if the test completed successfully.

wordErrorRate.description: The word error rate of the tested model.

Endpoint.name: Endpoint
Endpoint.description: Supported Cognitive Services endpoints (protocol and hostname, for example: https://westus.api.cognitive.microsoft.com).

skipQueryParameter.name: skip
skipQueryParameter.description: Number of transcriptions that will be skipped.

takeQueryParameter.name: take
takeQueryParameter.description: Number of transcriptions that will be included after skipping.

api_key.name: Ocp-Apim-Subscription-Key
api_key.description: Provide your cognitive services account key here.

token.name: Authorization
token.description: Provide an access token from the JWT returned by the STS of this region. Make sure to add the management scope to the token by adding the following query string to the STS URL: ?scope=speechservicesmanagement
